title: Ramsey 2-Complete Set
content: IsRamsey2Complete A means for every 2-colouring of A, some colour class has subset sums covering all sufficiently large integers. This is the central robustness property.

title: Burr–Erdős Lower Bound
content: Burr and Erdős (1985) proved that no Ramsey 2-complete set can satisfy |A ∩ [1,N]| ≤ c(log N)² for all large N. This gives the lower bound on growth rate.

title: Conlon–Fox–Pham Construction
content: Conlon, Fox, and Pham (2021) constructed a Ramsey 2-complete set with |A ∩ [1,N]| ≪ (log N)². This matches the Burr–Erdős lower bound up to constants, solving the problem.

title: Erdős Problem 54 (Solved)
content: The minimum growth rate of a Ramsey 2-complete set is Θ((log N)²). Both the lower bound (Burr–Erdős) and matching upper bound (Conlon–Fox–Pham) are captured.

title: Earlier Upper Bound
content: Burr and Erdős (1985) gave the initial upper bound (2 log₂ N)³, which was improved by Conlon–Fox–Pham to (log N)².
